update.description:
First version of the communications API. These are the three main components of this pull request:

* SwarmBrokerPlugin: World plugin that centralizes all the communication sent from the agents.

* SwarmRobotPlugin: Model plugin that will be the base class from which to derive when creating a plugin to control an agent. It provides all the communication functionality to the agent plugin.

* TeamControllerPlugin: This is an example model plugin that shows how the teams would use the Swarm API.

I have included a sample world file for testing the functionality.

Compile as usual, and then run:

`gzserver ../worlds/swarm_empty.world --verbose`

I'll start working on tests on the next pull request, this is big enough.
update.title: First version of the communication API

content.raw:
Made some changes [here](#!/osrf/swarm/branch/simple_comms_nate?dest=simple_comms#diff).

1. Renamed files to remove the leading "Swarm". Since we have the `swarm::` namespace, the additional `Swarm` in the class names seemed redundant.
2. Updated the documentation a bit (in the docs folder)
content.html:
Made some changes here.

  1. Renamed files to remove the leading "Swarm". Since we have the swarm:: namespace, the additional Swarm in the class names seemed redundant.
  2. Updated the documentation a bit (in the docs folder)

content.raw: It's used in the protobuf msg generator for compatibility with the Gazebo messages. We should probably get rid of it if we change the generator for using std::smart pointers instead.
content.html: It's used in the protobuf msg generator for compatibility with the Gazebo messages. We should probably get rid of it if we change the generator for using std::smart pointers instead.
